sentence.text: Yeast cytoplasmic translationD mutants grow poorly due to lack of 2*-O-methylated C32 (Cm32 ) and Gm34 on tRNA(Phe) , catalyzed by cytoplasmic translation-Trm732 and Trm7-Trm734, respectively, which in turn results in loss of wybutosine at G37 . Mutations in human cytoplasmic translation, the likely TRM7 homolog, cause nonsyndromic X-linked intellectual disability (NSXLID), but the role of FTSJ1 in tRNA modification is unknown.
